definition: to look through thoroughly in often a rough way
examples: … he and 15 staff members watched agents ransack the office.
In desperation, I ransacked my refrigerator for something else to whip up.
(figurative) Most novelists ransack their lives for that first novel; it might be called involuntary reporting.

definition: to search through and steal from in a forceful and damaging way : plunder
examples: Louis XVI was persuaded to risk a navy far from its own shores and to ransack the French arsenals for arms and ammunition …
